winery: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande
description: This wine is full of freshness and life as well as serious tannins and structure. The two sides complement each other to give a wine that has power as well as delicious black fruits and acidity. With the tannins it will age well. Drink this balanced wine from 2025.
title: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande 2016  Pauillac

description: Smoky, woody aromas still show in this young wine. It has plenty of elegance as well, showing its pedigree with restrained fruitiness that will develop slowly. This balanced wine will be ready to drink from 2025.
title: Château Trottevieille 2016  Saint-Émilion

description: Fragrant and loaded with finesse, this radiant, full-bodied red opens with enticing scents of ripe black-skinned fruit, iris, cake spice and a whiff of camphor. On the linear yet delicious palate, elegant tannins and bright acidity support succulent black cherry, plum and licorice before a lingering tobacco finish. Drink 2021–2029.
title: Ciacci Piccolomini d'Aragona 2014  Brunello di Montalcino

description: One of the few ageworthy wines of the vintage, this radiant red boasts enticing scents of chopped mint, wild berry, tilled soil and pipe tobacco. It's linear, alluring and ethereally elegant, delivering juicy strawberry, red cherry, thyme and white pepper framed in taut refined tannins and racy acidity. It's still youthfully austere but loaded with finesse and a crystalline purity. Give it time to fully develop. Drink 2024–2034.
title: Il Marroneto 2014  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Fruity, floral and spicy in nose and flavor, this had time to age in both new French oak and concrete. Robust, powerful layers of powerful black fruit benefit from complex characteristics of white pepper and lavender with an unforgettable perfume tenacious in its intensity.
title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Sweetwater Springs Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

description: The winery's proprietary blend of 58% Merlot, 26% Cabernet Sauvignon and 16% Malbec is hugely impressive and memorable, with a smoky, toasted oak character. Plush flavors of blackberry and cherry jam meld with spice on the rich, round midpalate. It offers plenty of grip and concentration, finishing on a handful of dried herb.
title: Shafer 2016 TD-9 Red (Napa Valley)

description: From a historic site in the heart of the appellation, this hearty red is beautifully laced in flavors of dried plum, earth and spiced cake. There's an underlying raciness to the acidity that keeps it fresh and focused.
title: Williams Selyem 2017 Fanucchi-Wood Road Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

description: Dark- and light-skinned Sémillon are picked together, then whole-bunch pressed and fermented together for this stunning wine. Pure and direct, it opens with pristine aromas of fresh melon, yellow apple, white strawberry hull and honeysuckle, with a touch of ocean breeze in the back. The palate is bright and lively, with laser-cut acidity and a beautiful seam of stony minerality that weaves throughout the yellow apple, spiced orange and Anjou pear flavors. It's harmonious, complete and superbly balanced, with a lingering ginger-peach-tea accent on the close. Drink 2020–2030.
title: Alheit 2017 La Colline Vineyard Semillon (Franschhoek)

description: This is a chewy, substantially weighted and full-bodied red from the always impressive and nuanced appellation, a study in meat, garrigue and leather. Dark and brooding in savory fruit and herbal earthiness, it has a density that unfurls on the palate in slow waves of subtle blackberry and blueberry pie.
title: Alpha Omega 2015 Drew Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

description: Wild herb, perfumed berry and pressed rose aromas lift out of the glass along with a whiff of eucalyptus. Smooth, delicious and balanced, the lithe palate has great tension, doling out juicy red cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and baking spice backed up by vibrant acidity. Silky tannins give it extraordinary elegance and linear structure. It won't take years to come around but it also boasts good midterm aging potential. Drink 2021–2029.
title: Baricci 2014  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Bold tannins, rich fruit and good acidity combine in a wine that is powerful while always fresh. With acidity and stylish black-currant flavors, the wine's fruitiness comes through the tannins, finishing with a juicy, perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Canon la Gaffelière 2016  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine comes from a large (for Pomerol) 46-acre vineyard. It has weight and density as well as dark tannins and rich black fruits. It shows great style with its beautifully integrated tannins. This wine will age well, ready to drink from 2025.
title: Château la Fleur-Pétrus 2016  Pomerol

description: Rich, jammy and powerful, this wine is all about concentration and firm tannins. Ripe black-currant flavors add great juiciness at the end. The wine has magnificent potential. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Lynch-Bages 2016  Pauillac

description: Baked plum, new leather, sunbaked earth, wild herb and tobacco aromas form the nose along with a balsamic whiff of camphor. The tense, structured palate delivers dried cherry, cinnamon, crushed mint and licorice framed in firm fine-grained tannins. Give it time to fully develop. Drink 2024–2032.
title: Col d'Orcia 2012 Poggio al Vento Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: This is a delicious showcase of Syrah that exhibits both the spicy cool-climate aspects, as well as richer and savory touches of ripe fruit and roasted meats. Aromas of black raspberry, smoky flint and tar lead into a palate of rounded red cherry, charred beef, lavender and rosemary blossom. It's extremely complex.
title: Peake Ranch 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Aromas of cherry and boysenberry meet with roasted pork, smoke and flowers in this bottling from a coveted vineyard in the Corralitos area. There is great freshness and snap to the palate, which offers flavors of black raspberry, red currant, bay leaf, dried mint and crushed purple flowers.
title: Sante Arcangeli 2017 Lester Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Fruity in blueberry and black cherry, with a citrus-tinged undertow, this blockbuster beauty is a mix of sleek tannins and complex structure, offering undeniable deliciousness as well as something to think about. Gunpowder and tobacco give it a savory edginess and lingering finish of black pepper. Enjoy from 2025–2035.
title: Alpha Omega 2015 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: This wine shows all the power of the vintage, with rich tannins and sumptuous black-currant fruit. A lot of expensive work has gone into bringing this estate up to this level and this excellent bottling is the result. Drink the wine from 2025.
title: Château Batailley 2016  Pauillac

description: This divine and complex white delivers tones of almond paste, sea salt, lime and tangerine that are balanced by fresh, vibrant acidity. This is a well-balanced, food-friendly wine that impresses from start to long finish.
title: Grgich Hills 2015 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Baking spice, red-plum, blue-flower and wild herb aromas emerge from the glass. The elegantly structured palate delivers juicy Morello cherry, raspberry compote and licorice while taut, fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity provide balanced support. A tobacco note lingers on the long linear finish. Drink 2023–2033.
title: Marchesi Antinori 2013 Vignaferrovia Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)
